title: Summon Guardian Golem
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

Summon Guardian Golem

[Summon Guardian Golem]() is a level 3 [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes")/[Summoning](/Summonings "Summonings") spell which summons a [guardian golem](/Guardian_golem "Guardian golem").

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 Tips and Tricks](#Tips_and_Tricks)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 References](#References)

## Useful Info

Summons a single [guardian golem](/Guardian_golem "Guardian golem"); it cannot attack, but it will immediately [share damage](/Injury_Bond "Injury Bond") done to other allies (but not the caster). When the golem is below 1/2 health, still alive, and can see an enemy, it will always gain the explosive [Inner Flame](/Inner_Flame "Inner Flame") status.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Higher [spell power](/Spell_power "Spell power") increases the golem's durability.

The golem's [hit dice](/Hit_dice "Hit dice") is `4 + <power> / 16` (randomly rounded).[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

Duration of the summon is around 27 turns. It is not affected by spell power.

There is a summon limit of 1; casting the spell again will cause the old summon to very quickly time out.

## Strategy

Guardian Golem serves two purposes. The first is defensive; the injury bond will increase the effective health of your summons. The golem can also take hits on its own. Even if you have no other allies, the golem still has enough durability to stand in a corridor and take a few hits while you retreat. It is also completely immune to [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes") and has resistances to several elements. Just be sure to keep a safe distance in case it explodes.

The second is offensive. When the golem is damaged enough, it will cause an [Inner Flame](/Inner_Flame "Inner Flame") explosion - a 3x3 explosion dealing 3d20 damage and creating [flame clouds](/Clouds#flame "Clouds"). Much stronger than any level 3 [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations") spell, but it requires some set-up. You can summon a golem in a corridor or other convenient chokepoint, take a step or two back, and let the fireworks ensure. (Since your golem won't attack enemies, enemies will ignore the golem unless it is in their way.)

Note that, in order for the golem to explode, you'll need to fight monster strong enough to kill it in time. [Gnoll](/Gnoll_\(monster\) "Gnoll (monster)") packs or [ogres](/Ogre_\(monster\) "Ogre (monster)") can kill a golem in time. Weaker monsters like basic [orcs](/Orc "Orc") won't.

### Tips and Tricks

- If you're next to a golem about to explode, you can summon another golem, causing the previous one to quickly dissipate.
- Gods that forbid harming your allies will not mind a Guardian Golem incidentally blowing up.
- Golems won't receive Inner Flame if there are only [invisible](/Invisible "Invisible") enemies in its [LOS](/LOS "LOS").

## History

- This spell was removed in [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"). [Martyr's Knell](/Martyr%27s_Knell "Martyr's Knell") and [Summon Blazeheart Golem](/Summon_Blazeheart_Golem "Summon Blazeheart Golem") were introduced in its place.
- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), guardian golems only had a 1/4 chance to be lit with Inner Flame.
- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), Summon Guardian Golem was a level 4 Summonings/Hexes spell.
- Summon Guardian Golem was added in [0.14](/0.14 "0.14").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [mon-abil.cc:1098](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.1/crawl-ref/source/mon-abil.cc#L1098) (0.30.1)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [spl-summoning.cc:878](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.30.1/crawl-ref/source/spl-summoning.cc#L878) (0.30.1)

Summon Guardian Golem

Summon Guardian Golem is a level 3 Hexes/Summoning spell which summons a guardian golem.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info

Useful Info

Summons a single guardian golem; it cannot attack, but it will immediately share damage done to other allies (but not the caster). When the golem is below 1/2 health, still alive, and can see an enemy, it will always gain the explosive Inner Flame status.[1] Higher spell power increases the golem's durability.

The golem's hit dice is 4 + <power> / 16 (randomly rounded).[2]

Duration of the summon is around 27 turns. It is not affected by spell power.

There is a summon limit of 1; casting the spell again will cause the old summon to very quickly time out.

Strategy

Guardian Golem serves two purposes. The first is defensive; the injury bond will increase the effective health of your summons. The golem can also take hits on its own. Even if you have no other allies, the golem still has enough durability to stand in a corridor and take a few hits while you retreat. The second is offensive. When the golem is damaged enough, it will cause an Inner Flame explosion - a 3x3 explosion dealing 3d20 damage and creating flame clouds. Much stronger than any level 3 Conjurations spell, but it requires some set-up. You can summon a golem in a corridor or other convenient chokepoint, take a step or two back, and let the fireworks ensure. (Since your golem won't attack enemies, enemies will ignore the golem unless it is in their way.)

Note that, in order for the golem to explode, you'll need to fight monster strong enough to kill it in time. Gnoll packs or ogres can kill a golem in time. Weaker monsters like basic orcs won't.

Tips and Tricks

  • If you're next to a golem about to explode, you can summon another golem, causing the previous one to quickly dissipate.
  • Gods that forbid harming your allies will not mind a Guardian Golem incidentally blowing up.
  • Golems won't receive Inner Flame if there are only invisible enemies in its LOS.

History

  • This spell was removed in 0.31. Martyr's Knell and Summon Blazeheart Golem were introduced in its place.
  • Prior to 0.27, guardian golems only had a 1/4 chance to be lit with Inner Flame.
  • Prior to 0.17, Summon Guardian Golem was a level 4 Summonings/Hexes spell.
  • Summon Guardian Golem was added in 0.14.
